oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Down in Dixie - Memphis, Tenn." Postcard Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Exterior Side One: "The Gateway to the South and West -- Memphis Tenn. -- Down in Dixie -- Industry -- Lumber -- Cotton -- Largest Hardwood Lumber Center and Cotton Warehouses in the World" -- Exterior Side Two: "River Front and Packet Wharves - Uptown District;" "Memphis and Harahan Bridges in the Heart of Memphis;" "The Cotton Carnival City - Memphis, Tenn. - Down in Dixie"

Interior: "Memphis, Down-in-Dixie Welcomes You" introduction; "Union Station" image; "Pink Palace, Museum of Natural History and Industrial Arts" image; "Southwestern College, 'The College of the Mississippi Valley'" image; "Conservatory and Bird House at Zoo" image; "Entrance to Zoological Garden, Overton Park" image; "Court Square in the Heart of Memphis, Tenn." image; "Lake showing Pavilion in the Distance, Overton Park" image; "Auditorium" image; "Memphis and Harahan Bridges" image; "Federal Building and Post Office" image; "Harvest Time in Dixie - A Cotton Field in Full Bloom" image; "Cossitt Library, Federal Building and Post Office" image; "Confederate Park, Post Office and Mississippi River by Moonlight" image; "John Gaston Hospital, Baptist Hospital and the University of Tennessee" image; Hotel Claridge advertisement; "River Front and Levee to Business District" image; "Riverside Drive along Mississippi River" image; "Sunken Garden and Entrance to Morningside Park on the Speedway" image;
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: downtown; bridges; hospitals; parks; Mississippi River; buildings; streets; universities; Memphis Zoo;
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Collection processed by Angela Price; digitized by S. Frierson;
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: SFPost073, SFPost074, SFPost075, SFPost076, SFPost077, SFPost078, SFPost079, SFPost080, SFPost081
